Description: ALASKA TRAILS MISSION IS: BUILDING TRAILS FOR ALASKAS PEOPLE, COMMUNITIES, AND ECONOMY. WE ACHIEVE THAT MISSION THROUGH A VARIETY OF EXCITING VENTURES. ON A SMALLER SCALE, WE HAVE PAID CREWS AND VOLUNTEERS WORKING ON INDIVIDUAL TRAILS AND TRAIL PROJECTS. ON A BROADER LEVEL, OUR TRAILS INITIATIVE PROGRAM WORKS TO CREATE MORE AND BETTER TRAILS IN ALASKA, TO HELP BUILD A STRONGER ALASKA ECONOMY, AND TO EXPAND YEAR-ROUND OPPORTUNITIES FOR EVERYONE TO BE ACTIVE, HEALTHY, AND HAPPY OUTSIDE. THE ALASKA LONG TRAIL IS THE SIGNATURE PROJECT OF OUR TRAILS INITIATIVE.ALASKA TRAILS TECHNICAL APPROACH FOR THE ALASKA LONG TRAIL PROJECT WILL ENCOMPASS MANY TYPES OF EDUCATION, OUTREACH, AND PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THE OUTCOMES OUTLINED IN THIS PROPOSAL. THIS WILL INCLUDE IN-PERSON MEETINGS, E-MAIL AND ON-LINE OUTREACH AND COOPERATION WITH OTHER GROUPS AND ENTITIES TO ENGAGE THEIR MEMBERS IN THE LONG TRAIL DIALOGUE. THIS PROJECT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE FEASIBILITY STUDY TO DETERMINE SUITABILITY OF THE TRAIL FOR NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL DESIGNATION. THIS PROCESS WILL REQUIRE MORE PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND THAT WILL FORM THE BASIS OF THE WORK. ENGAGING WITH THE PUBLIC HAS MANY BENEFITS, AND ALASKA TRAILS WILL WORK WITH COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS TO EDUCATE THEM ABOUT THE TRAIL AND SEEK THEIR INPUT ON HOW BEST TO ROUTE, PLAN, BUILD, AND PUBLICIZE THIS AMAZING ASSET.ALASKA TRAILS, IN COLLABORATION WITH OUR PARTNERS, WILL HOST COMMUNITY MEETINGS, AS WELL AS CONDUCT ONE-ON-ONE CONVERSATIONS WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS, LAND MANAGERS, AND USER GROUPS TO ENCOURAGE A DIALOGUE AND OPEN FEEDBACK ON THE LONG TRAIL. ADDITIONALLY, WE WILL PRESENT AT SCHEDULED COMMUNITY MEETINGS AND CONFERENCES. ALASKA TRAILS WILL USE SOCIAL MEDIA AND EMAIL CAMPAIGNS TO REACH A WIDE ARRAY OF PEOPLE. LONG TRAIL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH WILL ALSO BE ACHIEVED THROUGH TABLING AT COMMUNITY EVENTS AND HOSTING OUR OWN EVENTS THAT RAISE AWARENESS, INCREASE INVOLVEMENT, AND PROMOTE LAND AND TRAIL STEWARDSHIP.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: L23AS00168FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS APPLICATION IS TO LEVERAGE THE SOCIETY FOR WILDERNESS STEWARDSHIPS MISSION AND PROGRAMMING TO WORK CLOSELY WITH BLM STAFF TO REALIZE POSITIVE PROGRESS FOR THE BLM NATIONAL WILDERNESS PROGRAM.  THE MISSION AND OBJECTIVES OF THE BUILDING THE NATIONAL PROGRAM OF WILDERNESS STEWARDSHIP PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE THE STEWARDSHIP OF WILDERNESS AND WILDERNESS STUDY AREAS ON A NATIONAL LEVEL BY CREATING AND IMPLANTING NATIONAL-LEVEL TEAMS, PROGRAMS AND PROTOCOLS THAT COALESCE TECHNICAL GUIDANCE AND ASSISTANCE FOR STATE OFFICES TO CARRY OUT THE MANDATED ACTIVITIES OF WILDERNESS CHARACTER MONITORING AND WILDERNESS STUDY AREA MONITORING.  TO DATE, WILDERNESS CHARACTER MONITORING AND WILDERNESS STUDY AREA MONITORING COMPLETED BY BLM UNITS ARE INCONSISTENT IN METHODOLOGY, TECHNOLOGY, ACCESSIBILITY, AND DATA STEWARDSHIP. THIS MAKES IT INCREDIBLY DIFFICULT NOT ONLY TO TRACK AT A LOCAL LEVEL, BUT ALSO TO TRACK AND COMPARE AT A NATIONAL LEVEL. THE INABILITY TO TRACK THIS INFORMATION RENDERS THESE MANDATORY MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES ESSENTIALLY USELESS  YEAR ON YEAR THEY DO NOT PROVIDE NECESSARY INFORMATION, IT IS IN REVIEWING MULTI-YEAR TRENDS THAT INFORMATION IS GATHERED AND CAN BE APPLIED TO MANAGEMENT ACTIONS AND DECISIONS. FURTHERMORE, WILDERNESS CHARACTER MONITORING SPECIFICALLY IS A REQUIREMENT ACROSS ALL LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES, WITH THE SOLE PURPOSE OF DETERMINING THE BROADSCALE HEALTH OF THE NATIONAL WILDERNESS PRESERVATION SYSTEM. WITHOUT NATIONAL-LEVEL COORDINATION, PROTOCOLS, SUPPORT AND THE ABILITY TO SYNTHESIZE INFORMATION, THE BLM WILL BE UNABLE TO COMPLETE ITS PORTION OF THIS TASK IN A MEANINGFUL INTER-AGENCY WAY, HOBBLING THIS NATIONAL EFFORT TO BETTER UNDERSTAND INTER-AGENCY NATIONAL WILDERNESS HEALTH AND MANAGEMENT NEEDS.  N 2010, THE BLM PUBLISHED THE NATIONAL LANDSCAPE CONSERVATION SYSTEM (NLCS) 15-YEAR STRATEGY TO OUTLINE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOR THE NATIONAL CONSERVATION LANDS THROUGH 2025. THE NLCS HAS FOUR THEMES THAT DIRECT WORK ON THE GROUND LEVEL: (1) ENSURING THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF NLCS VALUES, (2) COLLABORATIVELY MANAGING THE NLCS AS PART OF THE LARGER LANDSCAPE, (3) RAISING AWARENESS OF THE VALUE AND BENEFITS OF THE BLMS NLCS, AND (4) BUILDING UPON BLMS COMMITMENT TO CONSERVATION. IN MEASURING ATTRIBUTES OF WILDERNESS CHARACTER: BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT IMPLEMENTATION GUIDE, IT STATES: THIS MONITORING EFFORT IS BASED ON THE STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS OF THE WILDERNESS ACT OF 1964. IN BOTH THE ACTS STATEMENT OF POLICY (SECTION 2(A)) AND USE OF WILDERNESS AREAS (SECTION 4(B)), MANAGERS ARE DIRECTED TO PRESERVE WILDERNESS CHARACTER. THE WILDERNESS CHARACTER BASELINE REQUIRES THAT STEPS BE MADE TO DETERMINE A BASELINE AND PROVIDE THE FOUNDATION FOR EVALUATING TRENDS IN WILDERNESS CHARACTER FOR FUTURE LAND MANAGEMENT DECISION-MAKING MODELS. THESE TRENDS INDICATE THE OUTCOME OF MANAGEMENT ACTIONS AND SUCCESS AT PRESERVING WILDERNESS CHARACTER AS REQUIRED BY THE WILDERNESS ACT ACROSS THE NATIONAL WILDERNESS PRESERVATION SYSTEM.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: L23AS00193FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT:  THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS CLEARLY DEFINED IN THE PROPOSAL TO AID THE BLM AND OTHER PARTNERS IN THE MANAGEMENT OF JUPITER INLET LIGHTHOUSE OUTSTANDING NATURAL AREA (ONA) TO PROTECT, CONSERVE, AND ENHANCE THE UNIQUE AND NATIONALLY IMPORTANT HISTORICAL, NATURAL, CULTURAL, SCIENTIFIC, EDUCATIONAL, SCENIC, AND RECREATIONAL VALUES OF THE SITE AS STATED IN THE CONGRESSIONAL DESIGNATING LEGISLATION (PUBLIC LAW 110-229 SEC. 202. MAY 8, 2008). THE PROPOSAL IS RELEVANT AS IT AIDS IN ACHIEVING THE DIRECTION SET BY CONGRESS IN THE ONAS DESIGNATION, MEETS WITH BLMS MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES AND PLANNING FOR THE SITE AND ALIGNS WITH DOI PRIORITIES RELATING TO EXPANDING ACCESS AND ENHANCING RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. THE WORK IS REALISTIC BASED ON THE EXPERIENCE BETWEEN THE PROPONENT AND THE BLM AND IS MEASURABLE BASED ON THE ACCOMPLISHMENTS OF THE SPECIFIC PROJECTS WITHIN THE PROPOSAL AND THE OVERALL CONTRIBUTIONS TO MANAGEMENT OF THE ONA E.G., EDUCATIONAL ENHANCEMENT, VISITOR SATISFACTION, SCIENTIFIC EXPLORATION ETC. THE TECHNICAL APPROACH CLEARLY IDENTIFIES THE METHODS TO ACHIEVE THE OBJECTIVES AND PRESENT A SERIES OF IMPLEMENTABLE PROJECTS SCHEDULED OUT OVER THE COURSE OF THE AGREEMENT. THE SUCCESS OF EACH OF THESE PROJECTS PROVIDES A MEANINGFUL APPROACH TO MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE WORK. THE PROPOSAL PROVIDES DETAILS OF THE TECHNICAL APPROACH AND OUTCOMES FOR EACH OF THE PROJECTS AND IDENTIFIES THE ROLES THE APPLICANT HAS IN ACHIEVING THEM. THE PROPOSAL INCLUDES A CLEAR SCHEDULE OF MILESTONES TASKS FOR THE DURATION OF THE AGREEMENT. GOALS   ESTIMATED TIMELINES: A)ENGAGE THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, SPECIFICALLY UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS, TO OFFER ENHANCED RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AT THE ONA AND THE BENEFITS OF OUTDOOR RECREATION.  1)PROVIDE ENHANCED, GUIDED, RECREATIONAL EXPERIENCES FOR A RANGE OF AUDIENCES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. 2)FURTHER ENHANCE KNOWLEDGE AND AWARENESS OF THE ONA, PUBLIC LANDS, AND BLM MANAGEMENT WITH PARTNERS ACROSS THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.  B)ASSIST BLM IN MONITORING NATURAL RESOURCES AT THE ONA. 1)PROVIDE FOR ONSITE STORAGE OF EQUIPMENT FOR OUTDOOR ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAMS, E.G., KAYAKING, FISHING, SNORKELING, HIKING. PROGRAMS WILL SERVE OUR LOCAL COMMUNITY, SPECIFICALLY INCLUDING UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.  2)MAKE THIS EQUIPMENT AVAILABLE TO ONA PARTNERS WHEN NOT IN USE BY LRD. MEASURES: A.COMPLETE THE INSTALLATION OF STORAGE SHED STRUCTURE AS APPROVED BY THE BLM. B.WE WILL CONDUCT A MINIMUM OF 3 FISHING CLINICS PER YEAR AND WILL FOCUS ON ENGAGE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. FISHING CLINICS WILL TEACH CHILDREN AND ADULTS THE BASICS OF FISHING INCLUDING FUNDAMENTAL SKILLS, SAFETY MEASURES, AND RELEVANT CONSERVATION INFORMATION.  C.WE WILL CONDUCT A MINIMUM OF 4 GUIDED KAYAK TOURS PER YEAR. KAYAK TOURS WILL LAUNCH FROM THE ONA, AND PARTICIPANTS WILL LEARN ABOUT AQUATIC HABITATS ASSOCIATED WITH THE ONA AS WELL AS ISSUES IMPACTING THE ONA SUCH AS EROSION AND SEAGRASS LOSS.  D.WE WILL CONDUCT A MINIMUM OF 4 GUIDED SNORKELING TRIPS FOR SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN AND OLDER TO DISCOVER LIFE BENEATH THE WATER NEAR THE BLM SHORELINE.  WE WILL OFFER GUIDED SNORKELING TRIPS IN SUMMER DURING LATE INCOMING AND HIGH TIDE PERIODS WHEN WATER CLARITY WILL BE THE BEST.

THE NORTH FOR SCIENCE  PROGRAM ENGAGES PRIMARILY URBAN, UNDERSERVED YOUTH IN AN IMMERSIVEFIELD SCIENCE AND OUTDOOR RECREATION EXPERIENCE IN NORTHERN ALASKAS PUBLIC AND WILD LANDS.NORTH FOR SCIENCE  AIMS TO ENHANCE SCIENTIFIC LITERACY, FOSTER A STEWARDSHIP ETHIC, AND FACILITATEDEEP PERSONAL CONNECTIONS BETWEEN PARTICIPANTS AND PUBLIC LANDS. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED BYTAKING A GROUP OF 7TH AND 8TH GRADE YOUTH ON AN EIGHT DAY TRIP NORTH THROUGH ALASKAS CENTRALBROOKS RANGE ON THE DALTON HIGHWAY, CAMPING AT BLMS MARION CREEK AND GALBRAITH LAKECAMPGROUNDS, AND VISITING UNIVERSITY OF ALASKAS TOOLIK FIELD STATION. WHILE ON THE TRIP, THEYOUTH ARE INVOLVED IN A VARIETY OF PLACE-BASED INQUIRY LEARNING ACTIVITIES LED BY BLM OUTDOORRECREATION SPECIALISTS, OTHER AGENCY PERSONNEL AND EDUCATION SPECIALISTS, AND FIELD SCIENTISTS.THESE ACTIVITIES MAKE THE SCIENCE CONTENT RELEVANT AND COMPELLING, WHILE THE OUTDOOR CAMPINGNATURE OF THE TRIP ITSELF EMPOWERS PARTICIPANTS WITH THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO EXPERIENCEPUBLIC LANDS SAFELY AND RESPONSIBLY. AS THE PROGRAM IS FREE FOR PARTICIPANTS, NORTH FOR SCIENCE NEEDS SIGNIFICANT PARTNERSHIP SUPPORT TO OPERATE. THESE BLM FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST THEPROGRAM WITH STAFFING, INSURANCE, VEHICLE RENTAL AND SUPPLIES.NORTH FOR SCIENCE  FURTHERS DOIS AND THE ADMINISTRATIONS PRIORITIES BY TARGETING UNDERSERVED,LOW-INCOME YOUTH, INCREASING AWARENESS AND UNDERSTANDING AMONG YOUTH OF HOW THE UNITEDSTATES STEWARDS ITS PUBLIC LANDS, AND EXPOSING THESE YOUTH TO A VARIETY OF POTENTIAL FUTURECAREERS BASED ON SCIENTIFIC INQUIRY, THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE, AND PUBLIC LAND RESOURCEMANAGEMENT AND STEWARDSHIP. NORTH FOR SCIENCE  PARTICIPANTS GAIN AN ENHANCED UNDERSTANDINGOF AND ACCESS TO BLM PUBLIC LANDS ALONG THE DALTON HIGHWAY CORRIDOR, LEARN HOW CLIMATE CHANGEIS AFFECTING BOTH THE SUBARCTIC AND ARCTIC ECOSYSTEMS OF NORTHERN ALASKA, AND LEARN AND PRACTICESAFE AND RESPONSIBLE OUTDOOR RECREATION SKILLS ON PUBLIC LANDS. AS SUCH NORTH FOR SCIENCE PROVIDES BLMS OUTDOOR RECREATION SPECIALISTS OPPORTUNITIES TO INTERACT WITH AND EDUCATE ANENGAGED AND ENTHUSIASTIC GROUP OF UNDERSERVED YOUTH. THIS DIRECT INTERACTION WITH PROGRAMPARTICIPANTS WILL ASSIST BLM IN DEVELOPING FUTURE MANAGEMENT ACTIONS REGARDING OUTDOOREDUCATION AND RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH ON PUBLIC LANDS. NORTH FOR SCIENCE  ALSOPROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY FOR BLM RECREATION SPECIALISTS TO EXPLAIN AND DEMONSTRATE THEIRCAREERS, POTENTIALLY IGNITING THE INTEREST OF FUTURE BLM CAREERS AMONGST PARTICIPANTS.NORTH FOR SCIENCE  DEVELOPS A FUTURE CADRE OF SCIENTIFICALLY LITERATE PUBLIC LAND STEWARDS. BYPARTICIPATING IN THE PROGRAM, THE YOUTH WILL DISCOVER INSPIRATION FOR FUTURE CAREERS RELATED TOARCTIC AND SUBARCTIC CLIMATE CHANGE SCIENCE, EARTH SYSTEM SCIENCE IN GENERAL, AND OR PUBLIC LANDRESOURCE MANAGEMENT. THROUGH NOTH FOR SCIENCE , PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN THE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS,AND PRACTICES NEEDED FOR SAFE AND RESPONSIBLE OUTDOOR RECREATION IN ALASKA. THESE OUTCOMESBENEFIT THE PARTICIPANTS DIRECTLY, AND THE PUBLIC AT LARGE AS OUR PUBLIC LANDS CAN BEST BESTEWARDED BY A CITIZENRY WHO HAVE DIRECT KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE OF SAFE AND RESPONSIBLEOUTDOOR RECREATIONAL USE OF THOSE LANDS.

WYOMING PATHWAYS WILL BUILD COOPERATION AND COORDINATION AMONG FREMONT COUNTY TRAIL SUPPORTERS, BLM AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES. CURRENTLY THE INTEREST IN PARTNERING AND POOLING FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES TO PLAN, BUILD, AND MAINTAIN TRAILS WITHIN THE FREMONT COUNTY AREA.FOR 2023, WYOMING PATHWAYS WILL OVERSEE THE UPHILL OPTIMIZED AND CONNECTOR TRAIL (J-LINE TO JOHNNY ON TOP) AS WELL AS BEGIN PLANNING OF 9-12 MILES OF NEW MULTI-USER TRAILS WHICH ARE PART OF THE JBR BLM MASTER PLAN. MANY LOCAL CITIZENS HAVE TAKEN PART IN TRAIL BUILDING TRAININGS AND ARE INTERESTED IN VOLUNTEERING ON THIS PROJECT AND OTHERS. THE GROUP IS COMPRISED OF TRAIL RUNNERS, MOUNTAIN BIKERS, AND HORSE-FOLK AND HOSTED AN ALL-USERS SESSION AT THE LANDER PUBLIC LIBRARY TO SOLICIT INTEREST IN MAKING CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE PROJECTS WE HAVE ON THE DOCKET. FOR 2024-25, WYOMING PATHWAYS WILL CONTINUE THE PLANNING FOR AND BUILDING OF 9-12 MILES OF NEW TRAILS COMPRISED OF SEVEN INDIVIDUAL TRAILS, WITH THREE NEW TRAILHEADS FROM THE PARKING LOT. THIS WORK WILL INCLUDE ALL PARTIES MENTIONED ABOVE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO CONSTRUCT, MAINTAIN, AND CARAVANNING OF THE NORTHERN ROUTE CONNECTING THE VILLAGES OF PT. LAY, WAINWRIGHT, UTQIAGVIK, ATQASUK, NUIQSUT AND PRUDHOE BAY. THESE OBJECTIVES ARE EXPECTED TO ACHIEVE THE SAME POSITIVE IMPACTS SEEN IN PREVIOUS YEARS CONDUCTING THE CWAT PROJECTS. FOR EXAMPLE, A BRAND NEW EXTERIOR DOOR THAT COSTS  145.00 AND IS AIRFREIGHTED FROM ANCHORAGE TO ANAKTUVUK PASS, ALASKA ADDED AN ADDITIONAL SHIPPING COST OF  1,200 00 AND A TOTAL OF  1,345.00 FOR ONE DOOR. ADDED SHIPPING COSTS FOR AIRFREIGHT HAS BEEN A COMMON ISSUE IN RURAL ALASKA AND CONTINUE TO BURDEN THE ALASKAN RESIDENTS OF THE NORTH SLOPE. ANOTHER SOURCE USED FOR SHIPPING FREIGHT IS THE ANNUAL BARGE WHERE SHIPPING ONLY OCCURS IN THE SUMMER MONTHS FOR THE NORTH SLOPE COASTAL VILLAGES. THIS LEAVES ALL OTHER SEASONS TO BE DEPENDENT ON AIRFREIGHT AND COSTS FOR BASIC AND ESSENTIAL NEEDS ARE EXTREMELY HIGH. HAVING A WINTER SEASON TO BRING IN THESE SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT WILL BE A GREAT BENEFIT TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE NORTH SLOPE BOROUGH.

IDAHO RECREATION AND TOURISM INITIATIVE (IRTI) IS A COALITION OF STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES AND NONPROFITORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING SUSTAINABLE AND RESPONSIBLY MANAGED OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL ANDTOURISM OPPORTUNITIES IN IDAHO.AN IMPORTANT PART OF THE IRTI IS THE POSITION OF THE PROJECT COORDINATOR TO FACILITATE THE WORK OF THE GROUP.THE PROJECT COORDINATOR WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE STAKEHOLDERS IN PROJECT AND EVENT PLANNING, BUDGETPLANNING, RECORD KEEPING, COMMUNICATIONS WITHIN AND OUTSIDE OF THE GROUP, AND REPRESENTATION OF THEGROUP TO OTHER ENTITIES.THE GROUP MEETS APPROXIMATELY SIX TIMES A YEAR TO COLLABORATE ON VARIOUS PROJECTS. THE PROJECTCOORDINATOR FACILITATES THESE MEETINGS AS WELL AS HELPS WITH THE PROJECTS OF THE GROUP. LIKEWISE, THE PROJECTCOORDINATOR HELPS MAINTAIN THE PUBLIC PRESENCE AND MESSAGE OF IRTI VIA WEBSITE AND SOCIAL MEDIA.

BE OUTSIDE, IDAHO (BOI) IS A PROJECT OF THE IDAHO RECREATION AND TOURISM INITIATIVE (IRTI). THIS GROUP IS COMPOSED OF STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES AND NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, WORKING TOGETHER TO PROMOTE OUTDOOR RECREATION AND TOURISM OPPORTUNITIES IN IDAHO. THROUGH ITS BE OUTSIDE, IDAHO PROJECT, IRTI WORKS TO PROMOTE THE IMPORTANCE OF OUTDOOR EDUCATION AND RECREATION TO THE PHYSICAL, MENTAL AND EMOTIONAL HEALTH OF IDAHOS CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE BE OUTSIDE, IDAHO SMALL GRANTS PROGRAM PROVIDES FUNDING TO ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO MEET THE OBJECTIVES OF BOI. SCHOOLS, YOUTH FOCUSED PROGRAMS, NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, CITY COUNTY GOVERNMENT PARKS AND RECREATION PROGRAMS, PUBLIC LIBRARIES AND OTHERS HAVE RECEIVED FUNDING. THE FUNDED PROJECTS SUPPORT ORGANIZATIONAL EFFORTS TO HELP CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES GET OUTDOORS TO LEARN ABOUT AND ENJOY IDAHOS BEAUTIFUL NATURAL LANDSCAPES AND OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES.

THIS PROPOSES FUNDS-SEEKING PROJECT INITIATIVES TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT EDUCATION, AWARENESS AND TRAINING PROGRAMS FRAMED FOR RIVER PROFESSIONAL AND MANAGERS WHO WOULD LIKE TO BECOME CONVERSANT IN THE MANAGEMENT OF THE AGENCY'S IRREPLACEABLE RIVERS AS RESOURCES, RECREATION DESTINATIONS, AND AVENUES OF CULTURE, HISTORY AND COMMUNITY THROUGHOUT ITS EXPANSE.THIS WORK WILL 1) ENABLE AGENCY LEADERS, MANAGERS AND FIELD STAFF TO UNDERSTAND AND ACT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THEIR RIVER MANAGEMENT ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES; 2) SHARE TRENDS, BEST PRACTICES AND DATA-BASED TOOLS FROM AND WITH COUNTERPARTS AT THE FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL THAT CAN ADVISE PLANNING EFFECTIVENESS; AND 3) ENHANCE THE AGENCY'S ROLE AND VISITORS' STEWARDSHIP OPPORTUNITIES AMONG BOTH CURRENT STAFF AND STUDENT APPRENTICES AS FUTURE RIVER PROFESSIONALS.THIS PROJECT WORK WILL FURTHER CURRENT ADMINISTRATION AND DOI PRIORITIES AND BENEFIT STAFF AND THEIR PUBLICS IN A NUMBER OF WAYS:1. TO PROVIDE INSIGHTS INTO SOURCES OF RIVER-BASED RENEWABLE ENERGY, RMS WILL HOST A LIBRARY OF 'CLIFF NOTES'-LIKE SUMMARIES FOR FERC-LICENSED HYDROPOWER PROJECT SETTLEMENT OR LICENSES, INCLUDING A NUMBER OF THOSE THAT ARE BUILT ON RIVERS ARE MANAGED BY THE BLM. RMS WILL REPORT ON LICENSE SUMMARIES AS REQUESTED BY AGENCY PERSONNEL, AS WELL AS POLICY UPDATES RELATED TO THE EVOLVING ROLE OF HYDROPOWER IN THE FACE OF CLIMATE CHANGE.2. THE ORGANIZATION WILL HOST DISCUSSIONS BETWEEN AND AMONG RIVER MANAGERS, RIVER ADVOCATES AND TRIBAL MANAGEMENT ON MODEL, TEMPLATE OR EXEMPLARY RIVERS. THE EFFECT OF THE DISCUSSIONS WITH AGENCY AND PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS IS THAT THEY WILL BE ABLE TO, IN TURN, SHARE LEARNING AND IMPLEMENT INNOVATIVE PROGRAMS AND BEST PRACTICES WITH THEIR RESPECTIVE PUBLICS.3. TRAINING AND NETWORKING EVENTS WILL SUPPORT SKILL-BUILDING FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH RIVER MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES, AS WELL AS PARTNERS OF RIVER MANAGEMENT ENTITIES. BENEFITS TO THE PUBLIC INCLUDE PROPER MANAGEMENT AND PROTECTION OF RIVER RESOURCE ENJOYMENT, AND EVOLVED AWARENESS OF NATURE OF OUTDOOR AWARENESS AND STEWARDSHIP.4. 30X30 CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION OBJECTIVES WILL BE ADDRESSED BY LEVERAGING AND BUILDING CAPACITY THROUGH THE CONSIDERABLE OVERLAP IN THE PROFESSIONAL RIVER COMMUNITY OR FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL JURISDICTIONS. IMPACTIVE AND/OR AMBITIOUS ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE INITIATIVES THAT AFFECT BLM RIVERS AS THEY AFFECT RIVER MANAGEMENT, STUDY AND STEWARDSHIP WILL BE DISCUSSED IN RMS PUBLICATIONS IN RESPONSE TO AGENCY STAFF INTEREST.5. ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE INITIATIVES OF INTEREST TO AGENCY STAFF AND RIVER COMMUNITIES WILL BE ADDRESSED WITH EDUCATIONAL AND AWARENESS TOOLS AND SYSTEMS OF LEARNING. THE NATIONAL RIVERS PROJECT WILL TO SHOWCASE RIVERS AS A NATIONAL 'LOCATOR' OF RECREATIONAL RIVER-BASED DESTINATIONS, STORIES AND TRIPS THAT ALSO SERVE HISTORIC AND SOCIAL INTERESTS.THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION OF THE VISION AND CAPABILITY OF THE RIVER MANAGEMENT SOCIETY TEAM TO SUPPORT THE BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT.

THE GOVERNMENT PERFORMANCE AND RESULTS ACT OF 1993 (P.L. 103-62) REQUIRES THAT THE BLM DEVELOP GOALS TO IMPROVE PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS AND PUBLIC ACCOUNTABILITY, AND TO MEASURE PERFORMANCE RELATED TO THESE GOALS. THIS VISITOR SATISFACTION SURVEY MEASURES THE PERFORMANCE TOWARD THOSE GOALS THROUGH A SHORT SCANNABLE VISITOR SURVEY. DATA FROM THE SURVEY ARE NEEDED TO ASSESS PERFORMANCE ON BLM GPRA GOALS 1.3.08, 3.1.02, 3.1.11, AND 3.2.01. THESE GOALS ARE TIED TO DOI STRATEGIC PLAN SPECIFICALLY MISSION AREA 1, GOAL 1, STRATEGY 2; MISSION AREA 2, GOAL 3, STRATEGY 3; AND MISSION AREA 3, GOAL 1, STRATEGY 1, GOAL 2, STRATEGY 1.THE PURPOSE OF THE BLM VISITOR SATISFACTION SURVEY IS TO MEASURE VISITORS' OPINIONS ABOUT BLM FACILITIES, SERVICES, AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. THIS EFFORT HELPS US MEET REQUIREMENTS OF THE GOVERNMENT PERFORMANCE AND RESULTS ACT OF 1993 (GPRA) AND OTHER BLM AND DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR (DOI) STRATEGIC PLANNING EFFORTS. THE RESULTS ARE USED TO MEASURE PERFORMANCE RELATED TO THE BLM GPRA GOALS REGARDING VISITOR SATISFACTION, AND BY BLM MANAGERS TO IMPROVE SERVICES AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED TO VISITORS, WHILE PROTECTING BLM RESOURCES.SPECIFICALLY, THE FUNDING REQUESTED WILL BE USED TO CONDUCT A SCIENTIFICALLY SOUND ANNUAL SATISFACTION STUDY OF BLM RECREATION VISITORS, IN ORDER:- TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE LEVEL OF VISITOR SATISFACTION WITH A RANGE OF OFFERINGS (FACILITIES, INTERPRETATION PRODUCTS, ROAD AND TRAIL MAINTENANCE, ETC.) FOR THE PURPOSE OF ALLOCATING LIMITED AGENCY RESOURCES TO MAINTAIN OR IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES AND EXPERIENCES ON BLM LANDS.- TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE STRENGTHS AND WEAKNESSES OF SERVICES BOTH AT THE SITE LEVEL AND AT AN OVERALL NATIONAL LEVEL.-TO MEET BLM GPRA PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS.THE RESULTS OF THIS STUDY WILL PROVIDE MANAGERS WITH INFORMATION ABOUT VISITOR SATISFACTION WITH CURRENT OPPORTUNITIES, INFORMATION, EDUCATION/INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS, FACILITIES, AND VALUE FOR FEE PAID. THE SURVEY PROVIDES SITE MANAGERS WITH INFORMATION ABOUT THE STRENGTHS AND WEAKNESSES OF VISITOR SERVICE AT THE SITE, THE SERVICE NEEDS OF THE VISITORS, SOME DEMOGRAPHIC CHARACTERISTICS OF WHO THEIR VISITORS ARE, AS WELL AS IDEAS AND SUGGESTIONS FOR IMPROVING CUSTOMER SERVICE. THIS INFORMATION WILL SUPPORT PLANNING AS OUTLINED IN THE DOI STRATEGIC PLAN. FIELD OFFICE AND SITE MANAGERS WILL BE ABLE TO USE THIS INFORMATION TO ALLOCATE LIMITED AGENCY RESOURCES TO IMPROVE PERFORMANCE WHERE SATISFACTION LEVELS ARE LOW.THE SOCIAL & ECONOMIC SCIENCES RESEARCH CENTER AT WASHINGTON STATE UNIVERSITY IS PROPOSING TO CONDUCT A BLM SYSTEM-WIDE SURVEY WITH AN ONSITE PAPER-AND-PENCIL METHOD AND AN ADDITIONAL ONLINE OPTION. THIS METHOD HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY APPLIED TO THE BLM VISITOR SATISFACTION SURVEY SINCE 2006.

THE MISSION OF THE MATTOLE RESTORATION COUNCIL IS THE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF NATURAL SYSTEMS IN THE MATTOLE RIVER WATERSHED AND THEIR MAINTENANCE AT SUSTAINABLE LEVELS OF HEALTH AND PRODUCTIVITY, ESPECIALLY IN REGARDS TO FORESTS, FISHERIES, SOILS AND OTHER NATIVE PLANT AND ANIMAL COMMUNITIES.
